intro: Adenosma bracteosa, commonly known as the bract-leaved adenosma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a bract-like appearance, contributing to its common name. Adenosma bracteosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
